channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: American singer-songwriter GIVEON on Beloved, a soundtrack of life's moments
item.description: American singer-songwriter GIVEON speaks with NPR about his highly anticipated new album, Beloved.

item.title: Examining the role of men in the gender gap in American society
item.description: The latest season of the podcast "Unsettled" from Iowa Public Radio looks at how gender affects people's everyday lives.

item.title: A surprise twist in the Trump administration's use of third country deportations
item.description: Chris Camponovo, a former State Department lawyer, examines what a multi-national prisoner swap says about the Trump administration's third country deportation strategy.

item.title: Why this is China's golden age of hacking
item.description: Dakota Cary of the Atlantic Council Global China Hub describes this moment as China's golden age of hacking.

item.title: Reporting on family separation and aggressive immigration enforcement in Florida
item.description: Behind the scenes with NPR's reporting on how Florida has become the scene of some of the Trump administration's most aggressive immigration enforcement efforts.

item.title: Tips for handling car emergencies
item.description: You might know the basics of car safety, like buckling your seatbelt or using your turn signal. But what do you do in car emergencies? NPR's Life Kit has tips for handline emergency situations.

item.title: The week when crypto won big in America
item.description: Congress passed the first major crypto legislation in the U.S., marking a major milestone for the digital currency sector. And with President Trump's support, the industry plans to march on.

item.title: Funding cuts will hit rural areas hard. One station manager explains how
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Tom Michael, general manager of Boise State Public Radio, about what the cuts to federal public media funding mean for his station.

item.title: Wu-Tang Clan finishes the farewell tour tonight
item.description: More than 30 years after the release of Enter the Wu-Tang, the group is finishing its 27-city North American farewell tour billed as The Final Chamber.

item.title: A closer look at Trump's approach to foreign policy
item.description: President Trump says he's already ended several conflicts around the globe and is working to conclude several more. We look at his approach to foreign policy.
